metadata.title: CVE-2024-5688 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
If a garbage collection was triggered at the right time, a use-after-freecould have occurred during object transplant. This vulnerability affectsFirefox < 127, Firefox ESR < 115.12, and Thunderbird < 115.12.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-5688` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:115.12.0+build3-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:115.12.0+build3-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:115.12.0+build3-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:115.12.0+build3-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:115.12.0+build3-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:115.12.0+build3-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:115.12.0+build3-0ubuntu0.22.04.1').
mozjs78: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
mozjs91: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
mozjs102: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
